Если бы не ебаный Гаррис мод, то не покупал бы этот кусок дерьма. А кусок дерьма потому что очень хуево регистрируются попадания, даже при пинге 30-50, про 70 и выше вообще молчу. Ну и делать в этой игре нехуй, особенно ночью. Кст за Гаррис мод деньги вернуть я не смог, в итоге не играю ни в то ни в другое... примерно - 150руб из кошелька (это еще с учетом скидок, по которым покупал). Выводы делайте сами, а я не рекомендую.
I think the entire Valve pack went on sale one time for $2 so I got this. Makes Garry's Mod look nice.

Buenísimo. No tengo palabras para describir lo bueno que es el contraataque a la fuente (traducción literal de Counter-Strike: Source). Buena jugabilidad, muy buen motor, y muchas cosas buenas más. Recomendadísimo, aún hay muchos servidores con mucha gente y te lo pasas muy bien. Muy barato, pero mejor si te lo compras con el resto de juegos que vienen en el pack completo de Valve, porque ahí solo hay J U E G A Z O S.

I had to pay $20 for some random resources for Garry's mod. Valve should really just have an expansion pack for Gmod with said resources, but they don't develop anymore so i won't expect anything from them anytime in the next Human Era. objectively source isnt bad. its great for the time it was made, its just so much worse than global offensive. im no Competitive nor an experienced player in any CS game, but i have experienced both and Global offensive is a more modern game and is certainly more fun, along with the fancier graphics and models. overall you probably got source back when it was the newest CS game, or for Gmod. either way its not very useful as a game to play all the time though some do still enjoy it.

I love this game. I played it for years and years (I'd say for over a decade?). I've also played CS 1.6 and CS:GO. Those two games are also great, but I vastly prefer CS:S. Why's that?

First off, the reason I admit - nostalgia. It's the first CS game I played and the last one I played. I played on tons of servers, tried all sorts of mods, played on a lot of maps, met all sorts of people... I played it for thousands and thousands of hours. I'm, surprisingly, still playing it a lot, whether to check out the servers I didn't see yet, to talk to some familiar faces or if I just want to blast some heads. Take your pick.

I also enjoy the simplicity. This is pretty much CS 1.6 (it makes sense since it's a remake of CS 1.6 in the Source engine). Don't expect the game to blow you out of the water. The weapons and maps are the same as from CS 1.6. Yet, it still feels new. It's based on a different physics engine, so it doesn't play like CS 1.6 does.

The visuals are, well, great. It looks pretty good even nowadays. If you crank up the visuals to the max (which shouldn't be hard to do on any PC), it's going to look really good. Hell, the game even has even support for higher resolutions such as 4K. I mostly played the game on a very bad mid-2000 PC with the lowest settings and I was satisfied at the time.

Cheating is something that was always a problem, but it doesn't happen all that much anymore. It seems that all cheaters had moved to CS:GO.

Well, is it better than CS:GO? I... don't know. I'd personally say it is, but I'm pretty biased towards the game. CS:GO is better if you don't want to spend a buck or if you want to play some competitive matches, maybe it you like official "mostly cheater-free" servers and different mods. But still... For some reasons I keep coming back to CS:S.

Please never die, CS:S.
